citations.narrative:
For the two most recent litters of puppies, there are no records of internal parasite medications given, and vaccination
records are missing for one of the litters. "Fiona" a French bulldog, had a litter of 4 puppies November 11, 2023. The
applicant says internal parasite medications (Fenbendazole and Pyrantel) and vaccinations were given according to the
schedule in the Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) but they were not recorded. "Lilly" a French Bulldog, had a litter of two
puppies on December 13, 2023. The applicant says internal parasite medications (Fenbendazole and Pyrantel) were
given according to the schedule in the Program of Veterinary Care, but they were not recorded. The vaccinations given at
6 weeks are recorded. The PVC also states that the dams will be treated for internal parasites at the same time as their
puppies, but there is no record of these treatments.
Treatments for internal parasites and vaccinations to prevent disease are very important for puppies. Dealers must keep
copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. This includes names of vaccines
and treatments administered and the dates of administration.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 5, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
For the two most recent litters of puppies, there are no records of internal parasite medications given, and vaccination 
records are missing for one of the litters. "Fiona" a French bulldog, had a litter of 4 puppies November 11, 2023. The 
applicant says internal parasite medications (Fenbendazole and Pyrantel) and vaccinations were given according to the 
schedule in the Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) but they were not recorded. "Lilly" a French Bulldog, had a litter of two 
puppies on December 13, 2023. The applicant says internal parasite medications (Fenbendazole and Pyrantel) were 
given according to the schedule in the Program of Veterinary Care, but they were not recorded. The vaccinations given at 
6 weeks are recorded. The PVC also states that the dams will be treated for internal parasites at the same time as their 
puppies, but there is no record of these treatments. 
Treatments for internal parasites and vaccinations to prevent disease are very important for puppies. Dealers must keep 
copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. This includes names of vaccines 
and treatments administered and the dates of administration. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by March 5, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
